title: Heck² patch
data:
| **Heck² patch**                                                          |                                                       |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------- |
| Author                                                                   | Kelly Bailey                                          |
| Download                                                                 | [link](http://www.multifoliate.com/nh/heck2/diff.txt) |
| [NetHack PatchDB](/wiki/NetHack_Patch_Database "NetHack Patch Database") | [78](http://nhpatchdb.alt.org/?78)                    |

The **Heck² patch** provides a collection of special levels to replace some of the maze levels in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). The new levels consist of fixed designs amid random mazes; the placement of levels into the dungeon is random. The patch is against [NetHack 3.4.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.2 "NetHack 3.4.2") but also works with 3.4.3. The patch has [a home page](http://www.multifoliate.com/nh/).

The patch makes extensive use of the [des-file format](/wiki/Des-file_format "Des-file format"), often ordering multiple MAP and MAZEWALK commands to produce the new levels.

There are five groups of Heck² levels: heck-a, heck-b, heck-c, heck-d, heck-e. Each game has a 25% chance of a heck-a level, a 50% chance of a heck-b level, a 75% chance of a heck-c level, a 100% chance of a single heck-d level, and four of the heck-e levels.

The heck-a levels include:

1. [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon") escorted by two [shriekers](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker")
2. [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater") escorted by [green slimes](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime") and [disenchanters](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter")
3. [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") and [master mind flayers](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer")
4. [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon") escorted by [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger") and [werewolves](/wiki/Werewolf "Werewolf")
5. [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars") and [iron golems](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem")
6. [liches](/wiki/Lich "Lich")
7. [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu") escorted by [minotaurs](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur")

The heck-b levels include:

1. a cross-shaped level
2. a room with many [trolls](/wiki/Troll "Troll")
3. a stream of lava with [red dragons](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon")
4. a maze of lava
5. a dark, open region
6. a small pool with [kraken](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken")
7. parallel, vertical corridors
8. hidden [closets](/wiki/Closet "Closet")

The heck-c, heck-d, and heck-e levels are less exceptional, but they insert open areas into the maze and sometimes unusual features like pillars or rounded rooms; they also insert solid wall, sometimes reshaping a level like 'm' or 'w'.

The [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch") incorporates the Heck² patch. [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") applies a modified version of the patch—some levels have been added to the mix, the numbers have been tweaked, and some of the least popular levels were removed.
html:
Heck² patch

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Heck² patch
Author Kelly Bailey
Download link
NetHack PatchDB 78

The Heck² patch provides a collection of special levels to replace some of the maze levels in Gehennom. The new levels consist of fixed designs amid random mazes; the placement of levels into the dungeon is random. The patch is against NetHack 3.4.2 but also works with 3.4.3. The patch has a home page.

The patch makes extensive use of the des-file format, often ordering multiple MAP and MAZEWALK commands to produce the new levels.

There are five groups of Heck² levels: heck-a, heck-b, heck-c, heck-d, heck-e. Each game has a 25% chance of a heck-a level, a 50% chance of a heck-b level, a 75% chance of a heck-c level, a 100% chance of a single heck-d level, and four of the heck-e levels.

The heck-a levels include:

  1. Demogorgon escorted by two shriekers
  2. Dispater escorted by green slimes and disenchanters
  3. mind flayers and master mind flayers
  4. Geryon escorted by doppelgangers and werewolves
  5. iron bars and iron golems
  6. liches
  7. Yeenoghu escorted by minotaurs

The heck-b levels include:

  1. a cross-shaped level
  2. a room with many trolls
  3. a stream of lava with red dragons
  4. a maze of lava
  5. a dark, open region
  6. a small pool with kraken
  7. parallel, vertical corridors
  8. hidden closets

The heck-c, heck-d, and heck-e levels are less exceptional, but they insert open areas into the maze and sometimes unusual features like pillars or rounded rooms; they also insert solid wall, sometimes reshaping a level like 'm' or 'w'.

The biodiversity patch incorporates the Heck² patch. UnNetHack applies a modified version of the patch—some levels have been added to the mix, the numbers have been tweaked, and some of the least popular levels were removed.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Heck²_patch&oldid=127221"

The '''Heck² patch''' provides a collection of special levels to replace some of the maze levels in [[Gehennom]]. The new levels consist of fixed designs amid random mazes; the placement of levels into the dungeon is random. The patch is against [[NetHack 3.4.2]] but also works with 3.4.3. The patch has [http://www.multifoliate.com/nh/ a home page].

The patch makes extensive use of the [[des-file format]], often ordering multiple MAP and MAZEWALK commands to produce the new levels.

There are five groups of Heck² levels: heck-a, heck-b, heck-c, heck-d, heck-e. Each game has a 25% chance of a heck-a level, a 50% chance of a heck-b level, a 75% chance of a heck-c level, a 100% chance of a single heck-d level, and four of the heck-e levels.

The heck-a levels include:
# [[Demogorgon]] escorted by two [[shrieker]]s
# [[Dispater]] escorted by [[green slime]]s and [[disenchanter]]s
# [[mind flayer]]s and [[master mind flayer]]s

# [[iron bars]] and [[iron golem]]s
# [[lich]]es

The heck-b levels include:
# a cross-shaped level

# a stream of lava with [[red dragon]]s

# a small pool with [[kraken]]
# parallel, vertical corridors
# hidden [[closet]]s

The heck-c, heck-d, and heck-e levels are less exceptional, but they insert open areas into the maze and sometimes unusual features like pillars or rounded rooms; they also insert solid wall, sometimes reshaping a level like 'm' or 'w'.

The [[biodiversity patch]] incorporates the Heck² patch.
[[UnNetHack]] applies a modified version of the patch—some levels have been added to the mix, the numbers have been tweaked, and some of the least popular levels were removed.
